abstract: Shares in Citigroup briefly plunged as much as 17 percent on Tuesday afternoon, triggering a new circuit-breaker mechanism that halted trading in the bank’s shares for five minutes.
snippet: Shares in Citigroup briefly plunged as much as 17 percent on Tuesday afternoon, triggering a new circuit-breaker mechanism that halted trading in the bank’s shares for five minutes.
lead_paragraph: The age of flash crashes hasn’t completely gone away.
